titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3920) to amend the Trade Act of 1974 to reauthorize trade adjustment assistance, to extend trade adjustment assistance to service workers and firms, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3920) to amend the Trade Act of 1974 to reauthorize trade adjustment assistance, to extend trade adjustment assistance to service workers and firms, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-417, by Mr. Welch (VT).

The resolution waives all points of order against consideration of the bill except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. The resolution provides that the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means, modified by the amendment printed in part A of this report shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 143.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 781.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 190 (Roll no. 1021).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 222 - 193 (Roll no. 1022).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 3920 (Trade and Globalization Act of 2007).
